image.altText: Lara Alexander, John Tucker and Jeremy Rockliff.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian MPs who quit their parties mid-term could be forced to leave parliament all together under a new Liberal proposal to "restore stability and certainty" â€” an idea slammed as a "Trumpian though bubble" or something from "Putin's Russia".

title.children: 'Trumpian' move to oust Liberal Party defectors from Tasmanian parliament blasted as 'undemocratic'

image.altText: A gold and blue badge of a white cap reads Tasmania Police

props.synopsis: The office of former Tasmanian police minister Michael Ferguson received a police briefing note warning of child sex allegations against a senior officer before the force held a police funeral and full guard of honour for him, documents obtained by RTI show.

title.children: Ex-police minister's office notified of child sex abuse concerns before Paul Reynolds's honour-guard funeral

image.altText: A young fair man wearing a chain on the beach

props.synopsis: Brad Balzan died a violent death in his own backyard. Some are calling it "the worst outcome imaginable of proactive policing".

title.children: Wearing a hoodie caused Brad to be stopped by police. Ten minutes later, he was dead

image.altText: Three people walk along rocks on a small island, with water and mountains in the background

props.synopsis: Tasmania trades heavily on its reputation for having an unspoilt environment, with tourists told to: "Come down for air." So, at the upcoming election, what is being promised to protect that?

title.children: What environmental promises are Tasmania's major parties making?

image.altText: Kysaiah Pickett celebrates with his arms wide

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs get their 2024 AFL season underway against the Demons at the MCG. Later, Port Adelaide hosts West Coast and Fremantle takes on the winless Lions. Follow live.

title.children: Gawn silencing some critics as Demons burst puts Bulldogs on back foot

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 3QT: Demons out to a 19-point lead over Bulldogs
Half time: Melbourne 8.5 (53) leads Western Bulldogs 6.5 (41)

image.altText: Composite image of Premier Steven Miles and Opposition Leader David Crisafulli

props.synopsis: The ABC's Antony Green declares the LNP a clear winner in the formerly safe Labor seat of Ipswich West, west of Brisbane, as counting continues after yesterday's by-election. Labor looks set to hang on in the seat of Inala despite an even bigger swing to the LNP.

title.children: 'Labor needs to take stock': LNP wins heartland seat of Ipswich West in by-election

image.altText: SophieÂ Allouache in a white dress and Penny Wong in a red blazer stand together smiling.

props.synopsis: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong tied the knot with long-time partner Sophie Allouache in Adelaide on Saturday.

title.children: Foreign Minister Penny Wong weds partner in 'special day' in hometown Adelaide

image.altText: A pink piggy bank sits on a pile of Australian money

props.synopsis: Having an idea about the average super balance in Australia for your age can help you take the necessary steps to boost any shortfall.Â

title.children: How does my super compare to others? Here's a breakdown of average super balances by age

image.altText: A blonde woman in a black shirt with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Blindsided staff and out-of-pocket customers speak out after Canberra day spa Adytum entered liquidation.Â

title.children: Audrey closed the doors of a Canberra day spa at 4pm. Within hours, she lost her job and was facing deportation

image.altText: An old drawing of vessel SS Nemesis.

props.synopsis: A technician looking for lost shipping containers off the New South Wales coast noticed an anomaly on his screen. It turned out to be the wreck of the SS Nemesis, which disappeared in a storm 120 years ago.

title.children: How a chance discovery helped solve the 120-year-old mystery of the SS Nemesis

image.altText: A tree is seen uprooted in front of a house during a storm on Groote Eylandt.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Megan is expected to intensify into a category three system on Sunday evening as the tropical low brings huge rains to Groote Eylandt and causes power outages and flooding in Arnhem Land communities.

title.children: Residents lose power and water as Tropical Cyclone Megan dumps big rains in coastal communities

image.altText: TikTok Block?

props.synopsis: TikTok is a "bad faith actor" and the social media app should be banned in Australia if its Chinese owner does not sell it, the Coalition's cybersecurity spokesperson says.

title.children: Coalition steps up calls to ban TikTok over links to China

image.altText: Six men stand together, one holding a saxaphone.

props.synopsis: You might not have heard their name but you've probably heard their music. Cymande broke up more than 50 years ago but their music went on to form the building blocks of hip hop.

title.children: Politics and race stopped Cymande in their tracks. 50 years later they're being recognised as fathers of hip hop

image.altText: Pierre Ricot looks stern standing amid the rubble of his home after it was torched by gangsters

props.synopsis: The Caribbean nation of Haiti is plunged into anarchy as powerful and violent gangs overrun the besieged capital, displacing hundreds of thousands.

title.children: An island nation is taken over by gangs. This is what life is like under Barbecue's reign

image.altText: Silhouttes of people watching as large red and orange smoke clouds rise from the ground.

props.synopsis: A volcano in Iceland has erupted for the fourth time in three months, sending orange jets of lava into the night sky.

title.children: Lava shoots into sky as Icelandic volcano erupts

image.altText: Goldfish in contrasting goldfish bowls symbolising inequality

props.synopsis: A Nobel Prize-winning economist has criticised the foundations of mainstream economics, writes Gareth Hutchens

title.children: Economics is in 'disarray', having placed efficiency before ethics and human well-being, says Nobel laureate

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz standing behind the podium looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Let me guess, you've finally gotten the hang of this trivia thing and you've come back for more? Well, let's see what you've got.

title.children: Call yourself a trivia whizz? Prove it. Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: woman sitting on cardboard box.

props.synopsis: TV series Expats has re-opened a conversation about the slave-like conditions of domestic helpers, mostly women from the Philippines and Indonesia, working for Hong Kong's rich.

title.children: What's life like as a domestic worker in Hong Kong?

image.altText: A woman with black sunglasses standing on a street smiling and carrying a black bag

props.synopsis: The lowest fertility rates in the world are seen in East Asian populations such as South Korea and Japan. But rates are even declining in countries like China and India. Why are women in these countries choosing to be child free?

title.children: Why are women in countries with the lowest fertility rates not having kids?

image.altText: A white car on CCTV.

props.synopsis: Detectives investigating the non-fatal shooting of a Bandidos bikie in Ballarat last year say the incident could be linked to a rival gang or an internal dispute. CCTV images show a light coloured Holden Commodore leaving the scene.

title.children: Police search for vehicle linked to Bandidos bikie shooting in Ballarat last year

image.altText: A very busy flag made of four smaller flags, which include a ship, shells, a globe, lions and a red cross on a white background

props.synopsis: From Sydney to Perth to Wagga Wagga, many of Australia's cities have flags.Â But they're mostly unknown and unloved. Here's why.

title.children: This Australian city flag has been called 'problematic'. Should it be changed?

image.altText: A graphic shows pictures of Marc Mietus and relevant vehicles involved in the cold case.

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old set off for Queensland in the first week of the new millennium in search of a fresh start. Detectives believe he was murdered before the month was out.Â

title.children: Marc Mietus picked up a hitchhiker at a NSW truck stop in January, 2000. Two weeks later, he vanished

image.altText: A gloved hand gripping a spray bottle.

props.synopsis: How do vinegar and baking sodaÂ work and is it worth using them together for cleaning? Let's unpack it.Â

title.children: Vinegar and baking soda is a popular household cleaner â€” but does it actually do anything?

image.altText: A women dressed in traditional Afghan clothing standing outside in front of some trees

props.synopsis: Hamida Samar was working at Afghanistan's Ministry of National Defence when the Taliban approached the gates of Kabul in 2021. She escaped via Pakistan, and is now making a new life in regional Victoria.

title.children: After a year spent hiding from the Taliban, Hamida fled Afghanistan with the help of Australian sponsors

image.altText: Jahrome Hughes looks to pass the ball to his left for the Storm against the Warriors.

props.synopsis: Halfback Jahrome Hughes may be suspended for two matches if he unsuccessfully challenges a contrary conduct offence following an incident involving referee Chris Butler in the Storm's win over the Warriors.

title.children: Melbourne Storm star faces NRL ban for referee contact

image.altText: People gather around vintage cars.

props.synopsis: As the Adelaide Motorsport Festival roars back for another year, tens of thousands of fans descend on Adelaide in scenes reminiscent of the Australian Grand Prix three decades ago.

title.children: Before Drive to Survive, the Adelaide Grand Prix was one of the biggest shows in Formula One

image.altText: A group of women in running attire

props.synopsis: More than 100 people have united for the biggest tribute run to date for Samantha Murphy, who was allegedly murdered after setting off on her regular Sunday run.

title.children: Samantha Murphy run attracts more than 100, as police search for answers continues

image.altText: A Nepali man with a scar on his face

props.synopsis: A document leaked to the ABC shows a worrying number of Nepalese men have joined the Russian army. But some appear to have been lured into Putin's war under false pretences.

title.children: The alleged scam luring Nepali men to Russia â€” only to drop them on the battlefield in Ukraine

image.altText: Millie looks to the left with a worried expression and a cut on her face as she stands alone in a dark room.

props.synopsis: Here's what's new to streaming, heaps good and out now â€” from two very different period dramas and The Gentlemen adaptation, to Kate Winslet's latest foray into the small screen, and a searing documentary about life in Gaza.

title.children: There's a glut of fresh content to stream right now. Here are the shows that are actually worth watching

image.altText: A close up of the front of a Boeing 737 MAX plane in the air, with its front wheels down

props.synopsis: As members of the travelling public, should we be concerned about the slew of recent incidents with Boeing planes? Well, yes and no.

title.children: After a slew of recent incidents, should you be concerned about flying on Boeing planes?

image.altText: sign above a rocky creek.

props.synopsis: The crystal-clear waterfalls and creeks of Far North Queensland are a huge drawcard for tourists and locals alike. But Royal Life Saving Australia says a serious safety rethink is required after the death of a man at Crystal Cascades.

title.children: Do inland swimming spots need lifeguards? Experts say it should be an option after tourist's death

image.altText: A cargo ship is seen from behind with the life raft visible.

props.synopsis: India saysÂ all 17 crew members of the Maltese-flagged MV Ruen are safe afterÂ commandos forced the surrender of 35 Somali pirates who hijacked the cargo vessel.

title.children: Indian commandos free cargo ship from Somali pirates
